results.title: Metformin prevents airway hyperreactivity in rats with dietary obesity.
results.journal: Am J Physiol Lung Cell Mol Physiol

citations.NLM: Calco GN, Proskocil BJ, Jacoby DB, Fryer AD, Nie Z. Metformin prevents airway hyperreactivity in rats with dietary obesity. Am J Physiol Lung Cell Mol Physiol. 2021 Dec 1;321(6):L1105-L1118. PMID: 34668415

results.title: Hyperreactivity of Blood Leukocytes in Patients with NAFLD to Ex Vivo Lipopolysaccharide Treatment Is Modulated by Metformin and Phosphatidylcholine but Not by Alpha Ketoglutarate
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ was the most effective in attenuation of @<m>DISEASE_Bronchial_Hyperreactivity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016535 @@@hyperreactivity@@@ in all groups of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Non_alcoholic_Fatty_Liver_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D065626 @@@non-alcoholic fatty liver disease@@@, but in @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ the effectiveness of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ was weaker than in lean.

citations.NLM: Zwolak A, Szuster-Ciesielska A, Daniluk J, Słabczyńska O, Kandefer-Szerszeń M. Hyperreactivity of Blood Leukocytes in Patients with NAFLD to Ex Vivo Lipopolysaccharide Treatment Is Modulated by Metformin and Phosphatidylcholine but Not by Alpha Ketoglutarate PLoS One. 2015;10(12):e0143851. PMID: 26629827
